intro: Oxytropis charkeviczii, commonly known as the Karakorum milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Oxytropis charkeviczii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for grazing animals in its native habitat.
